column4: hey: can someone help me? i want to make a welcome message whenever I open a new shell..anyone done this before?
i know how to do it when i log into a remote machine, just edit /etc/motd.. but how do i do that in a shell on my pc?
an echo in the resoucre file can do it
there are other ways to do it though
vi ~/.bashrc and add an echo line to the end
there is a way to system wide messages upon login
you might want to look into /etc/motd
hm  yeah.. i've done that on my server.. :)
you have to be a little careful - as sometimes applications logon as users - so ~/.bashrc is fairly safe but /etc/bashrc probably is not to do that
ok will keep that in mind
there is a distinction between an interactive logon and one that is not so read up on the bash files to find out which is which
now it looks cool: i have a tigger-head at shell startup:) thanks
